TEI.2.document_citation: Eugene Barker, ed., Annual Report of the American Historical Association for the Year 1919: The Austin Papers, (Washington, D.C.: Government Printing Office, 1924), 3 vols., Vol 1, Part 2, pp. 1031-1032
TEI.2.document_title: George Robinson to Stephen F. Austin, 02-02-1825

barker_notes.barker_summary: George Robinson to Austin, February 2, 1825. Land.
barker_notes.barker_citation: Eugene Barker, ed., Annual Report of the American Historical Association for the Year 1919: The Austin Papers, (Washington, D.C.: Government Printing Office, 1924), 3 vols., Vol 1, Part 2, pp. 1031-1032

text.body:
*div1 type="summary"* *p*George Robinson to Austin, February 2, 1825. Land.*/p* */div1*
*div1 type="body"*
*p* *location_mentioned*Lower settlement*/location_mentioned* *date_mentioned n="02-02-1825">February 2nd 1825*/date_mentioned**/p* Dear Sir I take the liberty of trubling you with a few lines when the lines of the half leage I gett in this *location_mentioned*settlement */location_mentioned*were run they were Extended 13 hundred bars in the *location_mentioned*prairie*/location_mentioned* if you allow mee anny more I wish itt *location_mentioned*on the Benard*/location_mentioned* I hope you will allow mee a half leage more and not leave me singular to my self I hope to Bee able to make you some payment this spring and if I can doo no better I will sell you some to pay for the rest Although I should consider my self robing my *person_mentioned*family */person_mentioned*to doo so If you lett me have anny more you will have itt in your power to know where there is good land and I will Be satisfied with anny you may designate mee hope you will take my sufferings in consideration And allowe what allmost Every other *person_mentioned*family */person_mentioned*getts I have heard that my *person_mentioned*father */person_mentioned*is on his way to this *location_mentioned*country */location_mentioned*and wishes to become a *person_mentioned*citisen*/person_mentioned* of this *location_mentioned*colony*/location_mentioned* and wishes to settle where he can have good stock water and ra[n]ge as he has a very large stock if he Ever getts them here I have been Expecting to here from you relative to the business with *person_mentioned*parker*/person_mentioned*— yours with respect and esteme—
*person_mentioned*George Robinson*/person_mentioned* [Addressed:] *person_mentioned*Col. S. F. Austin*/person_mentioned* *location_mentioned*San felipe de Austin*/location_mentioned*
*/div1*
